Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 01:17PM anndh wrote: Yep, my first set of numbers was from the needle core biopsy, and the second set of numbers from the pathology after the lumpectomy.  Weird, right? I have one sister who has read everything, who "gets" why I am going crazy waiting for my oncotype, so glad I found this thread to find I'm not alone in obsessing about it!
Posts.Title: Another Oncotype question mary71 Scarlet2

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2012 07:34PM anndh wrote: Got my oncotype score today = a big fat 34, so no question about chemo for me. My numbers were ER 99%, PR 22%, Ki67 32%. Going to start chemo on this coming Tuesday--TC every 3 wks, 4 times, then radiation.
Posts.Title: Another Oncotype question mary71 Scarlet2

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 12:27PM - edited Apr 26, 2012 12:28PM by anndh Thank you for this thread!!  And thank you, otter, for the information! I was supposedly triple negative (ER >5%, PR >1%, her2 -, Ki67 >1%), and then the final pathology gave completely different numbers:  ER 99%, PR 22%, Ki67 32%.  No node involvement, 2.5cm, lumpectomy. Have been waiting on pins and needles for two weeks for the oncotype, will find out tomorrow.  This has been a hard two weeks. But, if I were to throw a bet out there, I'm going to bet that my oncotype score will be intermediate, and that my MO will recommend chemo.  We'll see tomorrow. Do we not know anything at all about all the other variables included in the oncotype test?
Posts.Title: Another Oncotype question mary71 Scarlet2

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2012 12:39AM anndh wrote: 2 questions: When did you all stop wearing something on your head? Also, is #weeks "pfc" from the day of your last treatment? I got my last taxotere/cytoxan on July 3rd. Am I 4 wks pfc, or 1 wk pfc?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: anndh wrote: Well, hi.  Today is the fourth day since my diagnosis, and I guess it's time to join.  I have been reading these boards (and everything else I can find) for days, and I am very grateful for this board. The first day everything I read and heard sounded like I should be hopeful, but now I am back to freaking out.  I have an MRI today so I'm worried about other spots, and also am worried about the lymph nodes.  I'm a candidate for lumpectomy (depending on mri results), so I'm worried about recurrence if I pick that over mastectomy, and then I'm back to a total meltdown about the lymph nodes. I know my kids are freaked out by my constant crying. I have IDC in my right breast (approx 2.2cm), grade 2, Estrogen low pos (5%), progesterone low pos (1%), HER negative, KI-67 under 1%, p53 negative. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: worried about everything anndh christina0001

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 02:46AM anndh wrote: chapter4, if you didn't have small breasts would you have opted for a lumpectomy?  (Mine are big).
Posts.Title: worried about everything anndh christina0001

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 10:53AM anndh wrote: I can't thank all of you enough for all the support and information that you've shared.  I can't believe I am only on day 10 (after getting biopsy results)--I have gone through a bizarre process of emotions, discussions, learning, seeing several doctors (surgeon, MO, RO, geneticist), tests (MRI), dealing with my mother, on and on and on.  TODAY, I feel pretty good--I have a plan, and I feel good about the plan.  I'm going to have a lumpectomy, chemo, and radiation.   I have learned a lot, I have grilled all the doctors, I am not going to die (I hope I'm not going to die), and there you have it.  I still wake up and feel weird and cry, but hey.  Having this board is going to be really helpful.  Thanks again everybody.
Posts.Title: worried about everything anndh christina0001

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2012 02:45PM anndh wrote: Thank you all so much, so much.  This is all so surreal, and it helps to hear from all of you. Ann
